Tobit * or Tobias *__04.1: Therefore when Tobias thought that his prayer was heard that he might die, he called to him Tobias his son,
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.2: And said to him: Hear, my son, the words of my mouth, and lay them as a foundation in thy heart.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.3: When God shall take my soul, thou shalt bury my body: and thou shalt honour thy mother all the days of her life:
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.4: For thou must be mindful what and how great perils she suffered for thee in her womb.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.5: And when she also shall have ended the time of her life, bury her by me.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.6: And all the days of thy life have God in thy mind: and take heed thou never consent to sin, nor transgress the commandments of the Lord our God.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.7: Give alms out of thy substance, and turn not away thy face from any poor person: for so it shall come to pass that the face of the Lord shall not be turned from thee.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.8: According to thy ability be merciful.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.9: If thou have much give abundantly: if thou have a little, take care even so to bestow willingly a little.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.10: For thus thou storest up to thyself a good reward for the day of necessity.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.11: For alms deliver from all sin, and from death, and will not suffer the soul to go into darkness.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.12: Alms shall be a great confidence before the most high God, to all them that give it.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.13: Take heed to keep thyself, my son, from all fornication, and beside thy wife never endure to know a crime.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.14: Never suffer pride to reign in thy mind, or in thy words: for from it all perdition took its beginning.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.15: If any man hath done any work for thee, immediately pay him his hire, and let not the wages of thy hired servant stay with thee at all.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.16: See thou never do to another what thou wouldst hate to have done to thee by another.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.17: Eat thy bread with the hungry and the needy, and with thy garments cover the naked.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.18: Lay out thy bread, and thy wine upon the burial of a just man, and do not eat and drink thereof with the wicked.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.19: Seek counsel always of a wise man.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.20: Bless God at all times: and desire of him to direct thy ways, and that all thy counsels may abide in him.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.21: I tell thee also, my son, that I lent ten talents of silver, while thou wast yet a child, to Gabelus, in Rages a city of the Medes, and I have a note of his hand with me:
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.22: Now therefore inquire how thou mayst go to him, and receive of him the foresaid sum of money, and restore to him the note of his hand.
Tobit * or Tobias *__04.23: Fear not, my son: we lead indeed a poor life, but we shall have many good things if we fear God, and depart from all sin, and do that which is good.
